citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC failed to review the research facility's program for humane care and use of animals, to inspect the animal
facilities, and to prepare and deliver a report of its evaluations to the Institutional Official (IO) every 6 months. The IACUC
conducted these activities at the end of March 2022 and again at the end of November 2022 (8 months between
activities). IACUC activities including a review of the facility's program for humane care and use of animals and inspection
of animal facilities is important for ensuring IACUC oversight of animal care and use, as well as for ensuring compliance
with the Animal Welfare Act (AWA). Correct immediately (by 3/2/23), by ensuring that the IACUC conducts its functions
and activities at the minimum frequency (every 6 months) required by the AWA.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
After approving protocol #225 on 5/17/22, the IACUC failed to notify the principle investigator (PI) of its decision in writing.
Written communication from the IACUC to the PI regarding IACUC decisions related to the approval of animal care and
use activities is essential for ensuring compliance with the Animal Welfare Act (AWA). Correct from this day forth
(3/2/2023) by ensuring that the IACUC notifies the PI(s) in writing of its decision to approve, withhold approval, or require
modifications to secure approval of those activities related to the care and use of animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section
